description.comment: Staphylococcus aureus subsp. aureus strain GV69 belonging to the lineage ST239-SCCmecIII was isolated from a hospitalized patient presented with wound infection in Teresina, PI, Brazil in 1996. This isolate presents a natural attenuation of the agr-RNAIII transcription and a moderate ability to accumulate ica-independent biofilm.

bioprojects.title: Staphylococcus aureus Genome sequencing and assembly

attributes.name: host_description
attributes.value: Clinical bloodstream isolate CUBIST-27 is part of the Cubist Pharmaceuticals Isolate Collection. CUBIST-27 is the daptomycin-resistant isolate of the CUBIST-26/CUBIST-27 sequential isolate paired strains obtained from a patient with endovascular staphylococcal infection following daptomycin treatment failure. It is multilocus sequence type 5, clonal complex 5, SCCmec-II (+), spa type t062 / T1-J1-M1--G1-M1-K1. Compared to CUBIST-26, CUBIST-27 has sequence variations in yycF (R223K), and in mprF (T345K). It was previously described in a 2015 report as strain "C27".

assemblyInfo.assemblyMethod: Unicycler v. 0.5.0; Medaka v. 1.11.3; MaSuRCA v. 4.1.0; Polypolish v. 0.6.0

attributes.name: host_description
attributes.value: Patient with end-stage renal disease, atrial fibrillation, congestive heart failure, thromobocytopenia and recent subarachnoid hemorrhage presents with septic shock. Echocardiogram unremarkable, source presumed as pacemaker lead wires vs. olecranon bursitis. Treated with vancomycin + cefazolin. Discharged to outside facility and lost to followup. Duration of bacteremia: 2 days.
